column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=National has a 5-point plan for boosting New Zealand ’s economic performance .

#Text=We will bring discipline to government spending , boost investment in infrastructure , cut bureaucracy and red tape , create an environment to reduce pressure on interest rates and introduce an ongoing programme of personal tax cuts .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) What kind of improvements are you looking at making to the health sector , such as hospitals and ambulances ?
#Text=J.K. : Our health system is currently in a mess .
#Text=For all of Labour ’s extra spending on health , the public still do n’t think the services are that much better .
#Text=Despite the thousands of extra bureaucrats , the sector continues to lurch from one crisis to the next .
#Text=National is committed to delivering better , sooner and more convenient healthcare for all New Zealanders .
#Text=To do this we will put patients first , move to integrated care , put greater trust in health professionals and encourage innovation and sharing of resources in the health sector .
#Text=It is a very complex sector , with complex demands .
#Text=We have a discussion document currently out for consultation , it sets out ours ideas for health in greater detail .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Your party opposed interest free student loans at the 2005 elections . Should students looking to study in 2009 have anything to fear when considering voting National in 2008 ?
#Text=J.K. : National knows that education and training is the gateway to opportunity and independence .

#Text=We will be releasing our full education policies closer to the election but we have already announced our intention to lift educational standards and a youth guarantee that promises funding for education or training for all students up to the age of 18 to gain school level qualifications .
#Text=National will also keep interest-free student loans for tertiary students .

#Text=As an incentive to encourage faster payment of loans and help borrowers get out of debt sooner , we will also offer a 10 % bonus on a loan balance for voluntary lump-sum payments of $ 500 or more .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Do you feel the country should not be concerned at your mistakes you made on live television ?
#Text=J.K. : In public life it is often difficult to please all of the people all of the time , often you have to make calls that some people wo n’t like .
#Text=But unlike many of my opponents , I have not been a politician for decades .
#Text=I am comfortable with my style of leadership , which is very future focussed .
#Text=No one in National is under any illusion about the task that lies ahead .
#Text=I am the first to admit that we ’re all human and make mistakes from time to time .
#Text=I think most Kiwis appreciate that .
#Text=The important thing is to learn from your mistakes and I ’ve certainly done that .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Why do you feel the country keeps backlashing when you announce policies ? Why did you take so long to start putting out policies ?
